Business Proposal Smart Utility IoT

Smart Water Metering – Bahria Town

Deploying ultrasonic IoT metering infrastructure for one of Pakistan's largest residential developers.

Executive Summary

This strategic proposal outlines the transition from mechanical water meters to advanced ultrasonic IoT-enabled metering across Bahria Town's residential and commercial sectors.

The primary goal is to eliminate non-revenue water (NRW) loss, automate the billing cycle, and provide real-time leakage detection for property management.

Technical Scope & Architecture

  • IoT Connectivity: Private LoRaWAN network establishment for long-range, low-power data transmission.
  • Data Management: Cloud-based MDM (Meter Data Management) platform with automated SQL ingestion.
  • End-User Portal: Consumer-facing mobile application for real-time monitoring and digital payments.

Strategic Impact

By implementing this framework, Bahria Town gains critical infrastructure intelligence:

  • Reduction in non-technical water loss by an estimated 18%.
  • Predictive maintenance alerts for pipe bursts using pressure sensor data.
  • Unified billing cycle that integrates seamlessly with existing ERP systems.
Confidentiality Note: Full hardware datasheets, financial modeling, and proprietary network topology maps are available for review under formal NDA.
